problem:
An investment of $\$24,\!000$ is made in a government bond that will pay $1\%$ bi-monthly interest (meaning that the investment will increase by $1\%$ every two months). At the end of five years, what is the total number of dollars in this investment?

Express your answer to the nearest whole number.
solution: Five years make sixty months, so interest will have been compounded 30 times. That means that the investment will have grown to $\$24,\!000 \cdot 1.01^{30} \approx \boxed{\$32,\!348}$, to the nearest dollar.
model_solution:
Step 1: Convert the annual interest rate to a bi-monthly rate. 
$1\% \text{ per } 2 \text{ months} = \frac{1}{100} \text{ per } 2 \text{ months} = \frac{1}{200} \text{ per month}$
Step 2: Calculate the total bi-monthly interest rate over the five-year period.
$\frac{1}{200} \text{ per month} \cdot 12 \text{ months per year} \cdot 5 \text{ years} = \frac{1}{200} \cdot 60 = 0.3$
Step 3:
$24,\!000 \cdot 1.003^{30} \approx 25,\!927.41$
Step 4: Round the result to the nearest whole number.
$25,\!927.41 \approx 25,\!927$
$25,000 \le 24,000 \cdot 1.003^{30} < 26,000$
Round the result to the nearest whole number.
$25,927.41 \approx 25,927$
Step 5: Round the result to the nearest whole number.
$25,927.41 \approx \boxed{25,927}$
$25,\!927.41 \approx 25,\!927$
Final Answer: $25,927$
